# hera

<!-- badges: start -->
<!-- badges: end -->

The goal of hera is to handle the R counter part of the [xeus-r](https://github.com/jupyter-xeus/xeus-r)
Jupyter kernel. 

## Installation

You can install the development version of hera from [GitHub](https://github.com/) with:

``` r
# install.packages("devtools")
devtools::install_github("jupyter-xeus/xeus-r")
```
